property.name: IP
property.comment: IP of EQ Client, 127.0.0.0 is a wild card used to tell showeq to automatically grab the next eq session it finds

property.name: ArqSeqGiveUp
property.comment: Give up waiting for seq arq after cache fills to this size. Don't set this too low, otherwise showeq will artificially skip packets, minimum is 32, modem users may want to set 512, dsl and cable users may choose 256 or less

property.name: WorldOPCodes
property.comment: Name of the file containing data about world opcodes

property.name: ZoneOPCodes
property.comment: Name of the file containing data about zone opcodes

property.name: DefaultRace
property.comment: Default race of your character = 1 HUM, 2 BAR, 3 ERU, 4 WLF, 5 HIE, 6 DELF, 7 HEF, 8 DWF, 9 TRL, 10 OGR, 11 HAF, 12 GNO, 128 IKS

property.name: DefaultClass
property.comment: Default class for your character = 1 WAR, 2 CLE, 3 PAL, 4 RNG, 5 SHD, 6 DRU, 7 MNK, 8 BRD, 9 ROG, 10 SHM, 11 NEC, 12 WIZ, 13 MAG, 14 ENC

property.name: DefaultDeity
property.comment: Default deity of your character = 140 Agn, 201 Bert, 202 Brell, 303 Cazic, 204 Erol, 205 Bristle, 206 Inny, 207 Karana, 208 Mith, 209 Prex, 210 Quell, 211 Rallows, 213 Solusek, 214 Tribunal, 215 Tun, 216 Rodcet, 216 Veeshan

property.name: DefaultLastName
property.comment: Default last name of your character

property.name: FastMachine
property.comment: set to true if you have a fast machine to enable more accurate calculations

property.name: CreateUnknownSpawns
property.comment: Create Unknown Spawns for those spawns with incomplete information

property.name: SpawnLogEnabled
property.comment: set to true to log spawns

property.name: SpawnLogFilename
property.comment: name of file to log spawns into

property.name: WalkPathRecording
property.comment: enable the recording of spawn walk paths

property.name: WalkPathLength
property.comment: number of spawn walk points to save per spawn

property.name: Record
property.comment: set to true to record packets from session to Filename

property.name: Playback
property.comment: set to true to playback packets from session in Filename

property.name: PlaybackRate
property.comment: Rate to playback; 0 = fast as possible, 1=1x, 2=2x, etc.

property.name: FlushPackets
property.comment: Flush recorded packets to disk after each packet (useful for diagnosing crash problems)

property.name: CompressTime
property.comment: ignore timestamps (compress time) for pckts over 1 sec

property.name: Caption
property.comment: Skill list window caption when undocked

property.name: SkillWidth
property.comment: pixel width of skill name column

property.name: ValueWidth
property.comment: pixel width of skill value column

property.name: ColumnOrder
property.comment: order of columns in skill list

property.name: ColumnOrder
property.comment: order of columns in stat list display

property.name: StatWidth
property.comment: pixel width of stat name column

property.name: ShowRealName
property.comment: Display real eq name or formatted name

property.name: ShowRealName
property.comment: Display real eq name or formatted name

property.name: ShowFilter
property.comment: Display the map's runtime filter control

property.name: Framerate
property.comment: Map frame rate (number of map refreshes per second)

property.name: CacheChanges
property.comment: property that controls repaints, true = Just at repaint ast Framerate, or false = Whenever spawn/map info changes in addition to Framerate

property.name: CacheAlwaysRepaint
property.comment: always repaint the cache (slows map repaints)

property.name: SpawnDepthFilter
property.comment: Only show spawns between +HeadRoom and -FloorRoom of player

property.name: DrawSize
property.comment: Base size of spawn elements in display

property.name: GridResolution
property.comment: Distance between lines in the grid

property.name: FOVStyle
property.comment: Field of View Style based on Qt::BrushStyle, 0=No Background, 1=Solid, 2=94% fill, 3=88% fill, 4=63% fill, 5=50% fill, 6=37% fill, 7=12% fill, 8=Horizontal lines, 9=Vertical lines, 10=Crossing lines, 11=Diagonal lines (/), 12=Diagonal lines (\), 13=Diagonal crossing lines

property.name: HeadRoom
property.comment: Distance above player for spawn/map depth filtering

property.name: FloorRoom
property.comment: Distance below player for spawn/map depth filtering

property.name: ShowTooltips
property.comment: Gives you info about the spawn your mouse is over

property.name: WalkPathShowSelect
property.comment: Display Walk Path of Selected Spawn

property.name: PanDownLeftKey
property.comment: Key to Pan Down to the Left

property.name: PanDownRightKey
property.comment: Key to Pan Down to the Right

property.name: PanUpLeftKey
property.comment: Key to Pan Up to the Left

property.name: PanUpRightKey
property.comment: Key to Pan Up to the Right

property.name: AddLocationKey
property.comment: Key used to add a location

property.name: StartLineKey
property.comment: Key used to start a new line

property.name: AddLinePointKey
property.comment: Key used to add a line point

property.name: DelLinePointKey
property.comment: Key used to delete a line point

property.name: MapLineNormalKey
property.comment: Key to switch map to Normal Line display

property.name: MapLineDepthFilteredKey
property.comment: Key to switch map to Depth Filtered Line display

property.name: MapLineFadedFloorsKey
property.comment: Key to switch map to Faded Floors Line display

property.name: SpawnDepthFilteredKey
property.comment: Key to toggle spawn depth filtering

property.name: LogAllPackets
property.comment: Log al packets to global log file

property.name: LogZonePackets
property.comment: Log zone packets to zone log file

property.name: LogBazaarPackets
property.comment: Log bazaar packets to bazaar log file

property.name: LogUnknownZonePackets
property.comment: Log unknown packets to unknown zone log file

property.name: LogEncrypted
property.comment: log encrypted packets to encrypted log file

property.name: UnknownZoneLogFilename
property.comment: Unknown Zone log file (enabled with LogUnknownZonePackets)

property.name: Log
property.comment: Log spawns that match the specified logable filters

property.name: IsCaseSensitive
property.comment: Use case sensitive matches on filters

property.name: AlertInfo
property.comment: Display additional spawn information in alert message

property.name: SpawnAudioCommand
property.comment: Command line to exectue when an alertable new spawn is seen

property.name: DeSpawnAudioCommand
property.comment: Command line to exectue when an alertable spawn despawns

property.name: DeathAudioCommand
property.comment: Command line to exectue when an alertable spawn dies

property.name: LocateSpawnAudioCommand
property.comment: Command line to exectue when a new Locate spawn is seen

property.name: CautionSpawnAudioCommand
property.comment: Command line to exectue when a new Caution spawn is seen

property.name: HuntSpawnAudioCommand
property.comment: Command line to exectue when a new Hunt spawn is seen

property.name: DangerSpawnAudioCommand
property.comment: Command line to exectue when a new Danger spawn is seen

property.name: Enabled
property.comment: Enables ItemDB, setting to false will disable all ItemDB functionality within ShowEQ

property.name: DatabasesEnabled
property.comment: Databases enables is the logical or of the following values: DATA_DB=0, RAW_DATA_DB=4. So, to enable all database use 4 (DATA_DB|RAW_DATA_DB), the default is 4 (DATA_DB|RAW_DATA_DB)

property.name: DataDBFilename
property.comment: Name of file that contains item data in ShowEQ format

property.name: RawDataDBFilename
property.comment: Name of file that contains item data in Raw EQ format

property.name: SavePosition
property.comment: Save window x, y, width, height

property.name: PvPTeamColoring
property.comment: Colors spawnlist and map based on PvP teams

property.name: DeityPvPTeamColoring
property.comment: Colors spawnlist and map based on Deity PvP teams

property.name: KeepSelected
property.comment: Keeps the selected spawn in view

property.name: SystimeSpawntime
property.comment: Display time in unix time (seconds since 1970)

property.name: FormatFile
property.comment: Location of file containing formatted strings

property.name: SpellsFile
property.comment: Location of file containing spell information

property.name: NoBank
property.comment: set to true to print bank/inventory items to stdout

string.value:
ShowEQ - Experience,ShowEQ Combat, [ShowEQ - Experience,400,360,800,480,0][ShowEQ Combat,400,360,800,480,0]
ShowEQ - Spawn List 2,ShowEQ - Spawn Points,ShowEQ - Spell List,Map , [ShowEQ - Spawn List 2,64,1,378,190,1][ShowEQ - Spawn Points,0,0,378,118,1][ShowEQ - Spell List,0,0,378,136,1][Map ,0,1,378,766,1]

property.name: GuildsFile
property.comment: Location of file containing guild strings

property.name: GuildsDumpFile
property.comment: Location to write plain text file containing guild strings

property.name: DecodeKey
property.comment: Save the decode key for the current session/zone

property.name: SpawnsFrequency
property.comment: number of milliseconds between spawn list saves

property.name: BaseFilename
property.comment: Base filename used to construct the others, so for example the DecodeKey would be in /usr/local/share/showeq/lastKey.dat using the default location

property.name: KeyBaseFilename
property.comment: Base filename used to construct the others, so for example the DecodeKey would be in /usr/local/share/showeq/keyfile.dat using the default location

property.name: KeyPort
property.comment: Port that key will be sent to

property.name: Enable
property.comment: ONLY Enable this if you are a developer...

property.name: OpCodeList
property.comment:
A list of OpCodes seperated by commas...
Each Opcode has 4 arguments, only one of which is actually necessary... They are:
OpCode: 16-bit HEX value of the OpCode (REQUIRED - No Default)
Alias: Name used when displaying the Opcode (DEFAULT: Monitored OpCode)
Direction: 1 = Client ---> Server 2 = Client <--- Server 3 = Client <--> Server (BOTH) (DEFAULT: 3)
Show known 1 = Show if OpCode is marked as known. 0 = Ignore if OpCode is known. (DEFAULT: 0)
The way which you include the arguments in the list of OpCodes is: adding a ':' inbetween arguments and a ',' after the last OpCode argument.
(i.e. 7F21:Mana Changed:3:1, 7E21:Unknown Spell Event(OUT):1, 7E21:Unknown Spell Event(IN):2 )
If any argument is left blank, it is filled in with its default... (see defaults above)

property.name: Category1_Name
property.comment: Category for all spawns but filtered

property.name: Category1_Filter
property.comment: regular expression for all filtered spawns

property.name: Category3_Filter
property.comment: regular expression to match all PC's

property.name: Category4_Filter
property.comment: regular expression to match shopkeepers and bankers

property.name: Category5_Name
property.comment: Category matching all will-o-wisp's carrying GLS's

property.name: Category5_Filter
property.comment: regular expression to match all will-o-wisp's carrying GLS's

property.name: Category6_Filter
property.comment: regular expression to match all PC corpses

property.name: Category7_Filter
property.comment: regular expresssion matching all NPC corpses

property.name: Category8_Name
property.comment: category for all spawns matching Hunt filter

property.name: Category9_Name
property.comment: Category for all spawns matching all spwawns we want to be alerted about

property.name: Category10_Name
property.comment: Category for all spawns we want located

property.name: Category12_Name
property.comment: Category for spawns matching map Find queries

property.name: Category12_Filter
property.comment: regular expression matching any of the Maps 1-5

property.name: Create
property.comment: Causes this window to be created

property.comment: Causes this window to be created

property.comment: Causes this window to be created
